testInfo.name: Gesamtfragenkatalog zum Test „Leben in Deutschland“ und zum „Einbürgerungstest“

questions.germanQuestion: Welches Wappen gehört zum Bundesland Berlin?
questions.englishQuestion: Which coat of arms belongs to the state of Berlin?
questions.notes: The coat of arms of Berlin often features a bear, a symbol of the city and state.
questions.learningTechniques: Familiarize yourself with the unique design of Berlin's coat of arms, which prominently features a bear.

resources.description: Learn more about the coat of arms of Berlin.

questions.germanQuestion: Welches ist ein Bezirk von Berlin?
questions.englishQuestion: Which is a district (Bezirk) of Berlin?
questions.notes: Pankow is one of the twelve districts (Bezirke) of Berlin, located in the northeastern part of the city.
questions.learningTechniques: Familiarize yourself with the districts of Berlin, particularly Pankow, which is a significant residential and cultural area.

resources.description: Learn more about the districts of Berlin.

questions.germanQuestion: Für wie viele Jahre wird das Landesparlament in Berlin gewählt?
questions.englishQuestion: For how many years is the state parliament in Berlin elected?
questions.notes: The state parliament in Berlin is elected for a term of 5 years.
questions.learningTechniques: Remember that the term length for the Berlin state parliament is 5 years, similar to other German states.

resources.description: Learn more about the political system in Berlin.

questions.germanQuestion: Ab welchem Alter darf man in Berlin bei Kommunalwahlen (Wahl der Bezirksverordnetenversammlung) wählen?
questions.englishQuestion: At what age can you vote in local elections (election of the District Assembly) in Berlin?
questions.notes: In Berlin, citizens can participate in local elections starting at the age of 16.
questions.learningTechniques: Remember that 16 is the voting age for local elections in Berlin, giving young people an early opportunity to engage in politics.

resources.description: Learn more about voting rights in Berlin.

questions.germanQuestion: Welche Farben hat die Landesflagge von Berlin?
questions.englishQuestion: What are the colors of the state flag of Berlin?
questions.notes: The state flag of Berlin consists of the colors white and red, featuring a bear, which is a symbol of the city.
questions.learningTechniques: Remember the iconic white and red colors of Berlin's flag, along with the bear symbol.

resources.description: Learn more about the flag of Berlin.

questions.germanQuestion: Wo können Sie sich in Berlin über politische Themen informieren?
questions.englishQuestion: Where can you get information on political topics in Berlin?

options.germanOption: bei der Landeszentrale für politische Bildung
options.englishOption: at the State Center for Civic Education

questions.notes: In Berlin, the 'Landeszentrale für politische Bildung' (State Center for Civic Education) is a key resource for learning about political topics.
questions.learningTechniques: Focus on the role of the 'Landeszentrale für politische Bildung' in educating the public about political matters in Berlin.

resources.description: Learn more about the State Center for Civic Education in Berlin.

questions.englishQuestion: Which federal state is a city-state?
questions.notes: Berlin is one of the three city-states in Germany, along with Hamburg and Bremen. These are both cities and federal states.
questions.learningTechniques: Remember that Berlin is a 'Stadtstaat,' meaning it functions as both a city and a federal state.

resources.description: Learn more about the city-states of Germany.

questions.notes: Berlin is located in northeastern Germany and is both a city and a state.
questions.learningTechniques: Familiarize yourself with Berlin's location as a city-state in Germany.

resources.description: Learn more about Berlin's geographical and political status.

questions.germanQuestion: Wie nennt man die Regierungschefin/den Regierungschef des Stadtstaates Berlin?
questions.englishQuestion: What is the title of the head of government in the city-state of Berlin?
questions.notes: The head of government in Berlin is called the 'Regierende Bürgermeisterin' or 'Regierender Bürgermeister,' which translates to 'Governing Mayor.'
questions.learningTechniques: Remember that the title 'Governing Mayor' is used in city-states like Berlin, where the role combines both city and state leadership.

resources.description: Learn more about the political structure of Berlin.

questions.germanQuestion: Welche Senatorin/welchen Senator hat Berlin nicht?
questions.englishQuestion: Which senator does Berlin not have?
questions.notes: Berlin, like other German states, does not have a Senator for Foreign Relations ('Senator für Außenbeziehungen'), as foreign policy is handled at the federal level.
questions.learningTechniques: Remember that German states, including Berlin, do not manage foreign relations, which are the responsibility of the federal government.

resources.description: Learn more about the Senate of Berlin.
